name: Larson Construction Company v. Donaldson's Crossroads, Inc., Appellant
name_abbreviation: Larson Construction Co. v. Donaldson's Crossroads, Inc.

judges: Before Bell, C. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
parties: Larson Construction Company v. Donaldson’s Crossroads, Inc., Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Pee Curiam,
The appellant, the defendant in a mechanic’s lien action, appeals from the lower court’s order refusing its motion for judgment on the pleadings. The order is interlocutory and one from which an appeal does not lie. See, Weste v. Grayson-Robinson Stores, Inc., 417 Pa. 6, 207 A. 2d 851 (1965).
Appeal quashed.
opinions.author: Pee Curiam,

attorneys: Peter Cooper, with him Robert L. Zeman, and Zeman and Zeman, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Larson Construction Company v. Donaldson’s Crossroads, Inc., Appellant.
Argued April 27, 1965.
Before Bell, C. J., Musmanno, Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
Thomas R. Eddy, for appellant.
Peter Cooper, with him Robert L. Zeman, and Zeman and Zeman, for appellee.
June 30, 1965:
